, Andy Coulson , the shadow chancellor, Alan Johnson, and the lesser-known chief executive of Northern Ireland Water, Laurence MacKenzie, all resigned in quick succession. And what an array of reasons they proffered. Andy Coulson because When the spokesman needs a spokesman, it's time to move on , as he put it, cutting a rather longer story short; Johnson playing the age-old "personal issues" card; and MacKenzie because half of Northern Ireland's pipes burst and 40,000 people were without water supply
